Python: Python is a high-level, versatile language known for its readability and wide use in data science, automation, web development, and AI.
JavaScript: JavaScript is a dynamic scripting language essential for web development, enabling interactive and responsive front-end applications in browsers.
Java: Java is a statically typed, object-oriented language used for building cross-platform applications, especially in enterprise, Android, and backend development.
C: C is a low-level procedural language offering fine-grained control over memory and hardware, widely used in systems programming and embedded systems.
C++: C++ is an extension of C that adds object-oriented features, used for performance-critical software like games, engines, and real-time systems.
C#: C# is a modern, object-oriented language developed by Microsoft, primarily used in Windows applications, game development with Unity, and enterprise software.
TypeScript: TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript that adds static typing, improving code maintainability and scalability in large front-end and full-stack applications.
Go: Go is a statically typed language from Google, designed for simplicity and efficiency in building fast, scalable server-side and cloud applications.
Rust: Rust is a systems programming language focused on safety and performance, offering memory safety without garbage collection and ideal for secure, concurrent software.
HTML: HTML is a markup language used to structure content on the web, forming the backbone of all websites alongside CSS and JavaScript.
CSS: CSS is a stylesheet language that controls the visual appearance of HTML elements, enabling layout, color, and typography customization in web pages.
Lua: Lua is a lightweight, embeddable scripting language known for speed and ease of integration, commonly used in game engines and embedded systems.
Objective-C: Objective-C is a superset of C with object-oriented features, historically used for macOS and iOS development before the rise of Swift.
SQL: SQL is a domain-specific language for managing and querying relational databases, essential for backend data storage and analytics.
Bash: Bash is a Unix shell and scripting language used for automating tasks, managing systems, and writing shell scripts in Linux environments.
